Political Agent, Memorandum: - £ Reference your printed Letter No. C/54E dated 26th May 1946, regarding Hassan Yusuf, one of the Egyptian teachers seconded for service in Bahrain. I 2. This teacher has throughout his service been thoroughly unsatisfactory and having completed his two years in Bahrain he is not being re-engaged. 3. Before coming to Bahrain he was told that, he could not bring his family as no accommodation was available. He disregarded this order and arrived at Baghdad with a wife, a female servant and five children. Having no money with which to pay the fares of his family he borrowed money from the Egyptian Consul on the surety of some of his colleagues to whom he gave documents guaranteeing that he would repay them from his salary. He has not yet repaid them. He now claims that the Egyptian Government should pay his family^ fares, the Egyptian Government is not responsible. 4. He is due to leave Bahrain on 15th June when he will receive about lis. 2,000/- on account of Provident Fund, leave pay etc. As a special case he was allowed to draw the equivalent of one air fare to Cairo, amounting to approximately r.s.800/-, in advance. 5. With the cash at his disposal it will be possible for him to convey himself and his family to Egypt, by travelling third class. 6. The Bahrain Government is not prepared to give a loan to Hassan Yusuf whose conduct, especially in the matter of bringing his family here against the implicit orders of the authorities in Egypt and the Bahrain Government, has been extremely unsatisfactory. titleInfo.title: 'File 34/5 Correspondence Regarding Salaries, Leave etc., of Egyptian and Syrian Teachers in Employment of the Bahrain Govt'

physicalDescription.extent: File is arranged in chronological order, from earliest at beginning of the file to most recent at end.

Condition: Formerly bound with treasury tags, the file's pages have been unbound and are now loose.Foliation: The file has an incomplete foliation sequence and a complete foliation sequence. In addition, some of the folios have index numbers circled in red or blue crayon. The complete foliation sequence, which should be used for referencing, is circled in pencil, in the top right corner of the recto of each folio. It begins on the front cover, on number 1, and ends on the last folio before the back cover, on number 101.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials that relates to administrative matters concerning the hiring, pay and travel (to/from Bahrain) of Egyptian and Syrian teachers employed by the Government of Bahrain.Of particular interest are the following:Correspondence between British officials and the Near East Arab Broadcasting Station in Jerusalem regarding the suitability of an Egyptian teacher to provide sports news to the station alongside his role as a sports teacher in Bahrain (ff. 59-66).A translation and original copy (in Arabic) of an article written by Mahdi Ahmad Ali, an ex-member of the Egyptian Educational Mission in Bahrain, that was published in the Muslim Brotherhoodmagazine of Cairo in 1948 (ff. 71-73, 75) .
